t: Luke 15
Then*p drew near unto him all the publicans and sinners for to hear him.
And*p the Pharisees and scribes murmured, saying, This man receiveth sinners, and eateth with them.
And*p he spake this parable unto them, saying,

What*rp man*r of*r you,*r having*r an*r hundred*r sheep,*r if*r he*r lose*r one*r of*r them,*r doth*r not*r leave*r the*r ninety*r and*r nine*r in*r the*r wilderness,*r and*r go*r after*r that*r which*r is*r lost,*r until*r he*r find*r it?*r
And*rp when*r he*r hath*r found*r it,*r he*r layeth*r it*r on*r his*r shoulders,*r rejoicing.*r

And*rp when*r he*r cometh*r home,*r he*r calleth*r together*r his*r friends*r and*r neighbours,*r saying*r unto*r them,*r Rejoice*r with*r me;*r for*r I*r have*r found*r my*r sheep*r which*r was*r lost.*r

I*rp say*r unto*r you,*r that*r likewise*r joy*r shall*r be*r in*r heaven*r over*r one*r sinner*r that*r repenteth,*r more*r than*r over*r ninety*r and*r nine*r just*r persons,*r which*r need*r no*r repentance.*r

Either*rp what*r woman*r having*r ten*r pieces*r of*r silver,*r if*r she*r lose*r one*r piece,*r doth*r not*r light*r a*r candle,*r and*r sweep*r the*r house,*r and*r seek*r diligently*r till*r she*r find*r it?*r

And*rp when*r she*r hath*r found*r it,*r she*r calleth*r her*r friends*r and*r her*r neighbours*r together,*r saying,*r Rejoice*r with*r me;*r for*r I*r have*r found*r the*r piece*r which*r I*r had*r lost.*r
Likewise,*rp I*r say*r unto*r you,*r there*r is*r joy*r in*r the*r presence*r of*r the*r angels*r of*r God*r over*r one*r sinner*r that*r repenteth.*r
And*p he said, A*r certain*r man*r had*r two*r sons:*r
And*rp the*r younger*r of*r them*r said*r to*r his*r father,*r Father,*r give*r me*r the*r portion*r of*r goods*r that*r falleth*r to*r me.*r And*r he*r divided*r unto*r them*r his*r living.*r

And*rp not*r many*r days*r after*r the*r younger*r son*r gathered*r all*r together,*r and*r took*r his*r journey*r into*r a*r far*r country,*r and*r there*r wasted*r his*r substance*r with*r riotous*r living.*r
And*rp when*r he*r had*r spent*r all,*r there*r arose*r a*r mighty*r famine*r in*r that*r land;*r and*r he*r began*r to*r be*r in*r want.*r
And*rp he*r went*r and*r joined*r himself*r to*r a*r citizen*r of*r that*r country;*r and*r he*r sent*r him*r into*r his*r fields*r to*r feed*r swine.*r
And*rp he*r would*r fain*r have*r filled*r his*r belly*r with*r the*r husks*r that*r the*r swine*r did*r eat:*r and*r no*r man*r gave*r unto*r him.*r
And*rp when*r he*r came*r to*r himself,*r he*r said,*r How*r many*r hired*r servants*r of*r my*r father's*r have*r bread*r enough*r and*r to*r spare,*r and*r I*r perish*r with*r hunger!*r
I*rp will*r arise*r and*r go*r to*r my*r father,*r and*r will*r say*r unto*r him,*r Father,*r I*r have*r sinned*r against*r heaven,*r and*r before*r thee,*r
And*rp am*r no*r more*r worthy*r to*r be*r called*r thy*r son:*r make*r me*r as*r one*r of*r thy*r hired*r servants.*r

And*rp he*r arose,*r and*r came*r to*r his*r father.*r But*r when*r he*r was*r yet*r a*r great*r way*r off,*r his*r father*r saw*r him,*r and*r had*r compassion,*r and*r ran,*r and*r fell*r on*r his*r neck,*r and*r kissed*r him.*r
And*rp the*r son*r said*r unto*r him,*r Father,*r I*r have*r sinned*r against*r heaven,*r and*r in*r thy*r sight,*r and*r am*r no*r more*r worthy*r to*r be*r called*r thy*r son.*r
But*rp the*r father*r said*r to*r his*r servants,*r Bring*r forth*r the*r best*r robe,*r and*r put*r it*r on*r him;*r and*r put*r a*r ring*r on*r his*r hand,*r and*r shoes*r on*r his*r feet:*r
And*rp bring*r hither*r the*r fatted*r calf,*r and*r kill*r it;*r and*r let*r us*r eat,*r and*r be*r merry:*r
For*rp this*r my*r son*r was*r dead,*r and*r is*r alive*r again;*r he*r was*r lost,*r and*r is*r found.*r And*r they*r began*r to*r be*r merry.*r
Now*rp his*r elder*r son*r was*r in*r the*r field:*r and*r as*r he*r came*r and*r drew*r nigh*r to*r the*r house,*r he*r heard*r musick*r and*r dancing.*r
And*rp he*r called*r one*r of*r the*r servants,*r and*r asked*r what*r these*r things*r meant.*r
And*rp he*r said*r unto*r him,*r Thy*r brother*r is*r come;*r and*r thy*r father*r hath*r killed*r the*r fatted*r calf,*r because*r he*r hath*r received*r him*r safe*r and*r sound.*r
And*rp he*r was*r angry,*r and*r would*r not*r go*r in:*r therefore*r came*r his*r father*r out,*r and*r entreated*r him.*r

And*rp he*r answering*r said*r to*r his*r father,*r Lo,*r these*r many*r years*r do*r I*r serve*r thee,*r neither*r transgressed*r I*r at*r any*r time*r thy*r commandment:*r and*r yet*r thou*r never*r gavest*r me*r a*r kid,*r that*r I*r might*r make*r merry*r with*r my*r friends:*r
But*rp as*r soon*r as*r this*r thy*r son*r was*r come,*r which*r hath*r devoured*r thy*r living*r with*r harlots,*r thou*r hast*r killed*r for*r him*r the*r fatted*r calf.*r
And*rp he*r said*r unto*r him,*r Son,*r thou*r art*r ever*r with*r me,*r and*r all*r that*r I*r have*r is*r thine.*r
It*rp was*r meet*r that*r we*r should*r make*r merry,*r and*r be*r glad:*r for*r this*r thy*r brother*r was*r dead,*r and*r is*r alive*r again;*r and*r was*r lost,*r and*r is*r found.*r
